alternative_parents.description: Thioether derivatives of thiophenols. Thiophenol is a phenol derivative obtained by replacing the oxygen atom from the hydroxyl group (attached to the benzene) by a sulfur atom.
alternative_parents.name: Thiophenol ethers

alternative_parents.description: Salts or analogous metal derivatives of phenols.
alternative_parents.name: Phenoxides

alternative_parents.description: Organosulfur compounds a sulfenyl group with the general formula RS (R = organyl).
alternative_parents.name: Sulfenyl compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic salt compounds containing a transition metal atom in its ionic form.
alternative_parents.name: Organic transition metal salts

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a bond between a carbon atom and an oxygen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organooxygen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds with a positive electric charge.
alternative_parents.name: Organic cations

class.description: Compounds containing the ester derivative of thiocarboxylic acid, with the general structure R-S-R' (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
class.name: Thioethers

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as diarylthioethers. These are organosulfur compounds containing a thioether group that is substituted by two aryl groups.

direct_parent.description: Organosulfur compounds containing a thioether group that is substituted by two aryl groups.
direct_parent.name: Diarylthioethers

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Organosulfur compounds containing a thioether group that is substituted by an aryl group.
subclass.name: Aryl thioethers

superclass.description: Organic compounds containing a carbon-sulfur bond.
superclass.name: Organosulfur compounds
